resources.string: Robotix
Hello world!
Settings
Reach Us:
Contact Us
ROBOTIX, is the annual robotics competition held during KSHITIJ, the Techno-Management Fest of IIT Kharagpur which is one of the biggest of its kind.
Robotix is organised by the Technology Robotix Society, IIT Kharagpur which is the hub of all robotics related activities at IIT Kharagpur and fast becoming the nerve centre of robotics in India.

At Technology Robotix Society, we constantly endeavour to better ourselves as a robotics fest every year. Our exponential growth over the years, in both quality and quantity of participation, is testament to this fact. However, we are not alone in our growth. With every passing year, our participants have shown a steady improvement in their thinking and innovation in tackling our problem statements. This means that we can never afford to become complacent, and we try to do justice to the increasing quality of bot-making expertise every year.
Visit our website: www.robotix.in, for all information and updates on our activities throughout the session. Sign up to receive newsletters and important announcements in your email inbox.
Keep in touch with us through social media we have official pages on Facebook and Twitter, and a Youtube Channel.
1. How to register for Robotix 2014 events?
To register for any event of Robotix 2014, please visit the Kshitij 2014 website ( www.ktj.in )
2. What are the event dates?
Robotix 2014 is scheduled to be held from the 31st January to 3rd February, 2014
3. Is there any pre-registration?
You must register on the Kshitij 2014 website (www.ktj.in) before the fest in order to participate in Robotix 2014.
4. Where will I stay?
Accommodation will be provided in the IIT Kharagpur campus itself. For more details regarding accommodation please visit the Acco tab of Kshitij 2014 website (www.ktj.in).
5. Do you charge anything for taking part in the Robotix competition?
There will be a nominal registration fee (Rs. 800) and a fully refundable security deposit (Rs. 200) which is a total of Rs.1000 that is to be provided via a Demand Draft.
6. Is there any submission deadline?
There is no submission of any kind for any Robotix Event.
7. Who is the point of contact for my event?
Check the event page of the event you want to participate in. The name, email id and contact number of the event head can be seen on clicking on the phone icon.
8. I have accommodation related queries, whom should I contact?
For any accommodation related issues you can contact our Hospitality Head. You can find his contact number in the Contact Us tab of the application.
9. How do I reach Kharagpur?

Kharagpur is connected by direct train services to most major cities of the country. If your city does not have a direct rail route to Kharagpur, then catch a train to the City of Joy- Kolkata. KGP is situated 120 kms off Kolkata which is well connected to all the cities of India by rail and air. Kharagpur can be reached in about 2 hours by train from Howrah railway station of Kolkata or 3 hours by car from Kolkata Airport. Train from Kolkata to Kharagpur are available round the clock. The list of local trains from Kolkata to KGP can be obtained from ( http://iitkgp.ac.in/trains.php ).
10. How to reach the IIT campus on arrival at Kharagpur?

The first thing that you will notice on coming out of the KGP station will be the Participants Reception (PR) team, present there 24x7 from 1800 hrs, 31st of January. Periodic announcements will be made at the station addressing the participants. IIT KGP buses and the volunteers will be available to bring you to the campus. The volunteers will guide you to the Kshitij arena- The Vikramshila Complex. Moreover you can also take a cab to the IIT Campus. The fare from station to the IIT campus is Rs. 120 to Rs 150 (depends on your negotiation skills) and it is a 10 minutes ride.
11. What after reaching the Kshitij Arena?

You will be taken to the Control Tent where you and your team/ contingent will have to register. For the registration you will have to bring the printout of the accommodation form that has been put up on the website. After that you will be provided accommodation in the campus. After Registration in the Kshitij Arena, you will need to report to the Robotix Helpdesk (Vikramshila Foyer). Look around for notices showing directions towards the helpdesk. Your robot registration will be done on the Robotix Helpdesk. Registrations begin at the Robotix Helpdesk after 1800 Hrs, 31st January, 2014.
12. I do not want to waste my time, can you tell me when exactly my event will be held in the 3 days?

Robotix Events are multiple stage events. The prelims would be starting from the first day and the event finals will be held on the last day of the fest. Besides, you can also interest yourself in other events and workshops held in the IIT Kharagpur campus during Kshitij 2014. [http://www.ktj.in].
13.Do I need to make any video/paper submission to be eligible to participate?

Submissions of any kind are not required before the event. Although, they will be appreciated and would be eligible for best mechanical design awards which are separate and do not form any criteria for eligibility. Please note that all participants must register on the website to be eligible to participate.
14. How many members are allowed in a single team?
At most four people can constitute of a team.
15. When will I get my prizes and certificates?

The winners will get their prizes and certificates on the last day of Robotix 2014, i.e. 3rd February, 2014 during the Prize distribution ceremony. Those who need to leave early can contact the Robotix Helpdesk.
16. I need electronic components for my robot, where do I go?

We advise all participants to bring along sufficient spare electronic components. In case you need some help or suggestions with your robot, you can contact the Robotix HelpDesk. Inside Kharagpur, you can go to Chowdhury Electronics in Tech Market. You can refer the Campus Map for directions. You can contact Chowdhury Electronics on this number - +91 943 441 5812.
17. Where can I find the tutorials to a given event?
Comprehensive and detailed tutorials are available for all events on our website. From our homepage, click on the tab Tutorials > Event Tutorials > [Event Name].
18. I want to have a Robotics Workshop conducted at my college. Who should I contact?
Please mail us your workshop proposal, the requirements and suitable dates at workshops@robotix.in.
19. I have an event idea for you. How do I get it across to you guys?
Please mail us your event idea at contact@robotix.in
Iâ€™m a law/arts/commerce/management student. Can I participate?
We as a society promote hobby robotics and welcome participants from all fields of study.
